inlineContent.text: VectorDSP is a numeric library focused on vector operations using the Accelerate framework. The library is designed to be similar to MATLAB or NumPy and implements many of the built-in functions.
All operators and function are vectorized using vDSP.
Here is an example of a complex FFT using a recursive algorithm and its MATLAB equivalent:

code: public func fftx(_ x: ComplexArray) -> ComplexArray {
let omega = exp(-2 * Real.pi * Real.i / Real(n))

inlineContent.text: The library works with existing Swift types, using only Arrays, Tuples. For convenience, these have been given type aliases for the underlying native types. Only the Real need be defined, the others are all derived from this type.
Real numbers can be Double or Float types.
Real arrays are just normal Swift Arrays of Double or Float.
Complex numbers defined as a tuple of two real numbers, representing the real and imaginary parts of the number.
Likewise, a complex array consists of a tuple of two real arrays. This arrangement is sometimes known as split complex.
The imaginary unit, ‘i’, is defined as an extension to Real (Double or Float), similar to other constants such as pi. If you prefer to use ‘j’, the Real type can be extended.

code: /// The complex imaginary unit i, where i = sqrt(-1).

inlineContent.text: It can be used in any expression:
Ranges can be defined using the standard Swift Range or ClosedRange types, but with the addition of an optional ‘by’ value. This has been implemented as an extension to the Array type.
